name: IS1 - Operational Safety
intro: This form verifies your understanding of the safety and health responsibilities of personnel regarding themselves and others at incidents as defined in NCI 1. Completion is required for OSM compliance.

structure.description: Which of these must the OIC Crew do to ensure the safety and effectiveness of the firefighting crew?
options: Use the nominal role tally procedure and BA entry control procedures.
Follow operational procedures
Assist with operational tasks
Evaluate priorities, give direction and maintain control.
Establish an incident management structure
Populate the Entry Control Board
Monitor progress as it relates to their area of operations
Operate the Main Pump
correctAnswer: Use the nominal role tally procedure and BA entry control procedures.
Evaluate priorities, give direction and maintain control.
Monitor progress as it relates to their area of operations

structure.description: What must any FENZ personnel do if they identify a hazard?
options: Note the hazard for later reference during debrief
Bring the hazard to the attention of their OIC or the OIC Fire.
Record the hazard on the Entry Control Board
structure.correctAnswer: Bring the hazard to the attention of their OIC or the OIC Fire.

structure.description: Civilian and other agency personnel can be used to assist with FENZ operations as long as they have been made aware of all hazards, given clear instructions regarding the management of the hazards and briefed on the role they will be undertaking.
Who is responsible for ensuring the crew are wearing seatbelts when their appliance is mobile?
options: The driver
The individual
The Safety Officer
The OIC

structure.description: Who is responsible for specifying the appropriate type of PPE for the incident being attended?
options: The individual
The driver
The OIC
The Safety Officer

structure.description: BA will be worn by all personnel working in a contaminated atmosphere or any atmosphere suspected of being contaminated.
How many persons must be committed operationally at an incident for a safety officer to be appointed?
options: More than 10
More than 12
More than 16
More than 3 crews

structure.description: Which of these other situations must also have a Safety Officer appointed?
options: Hazardous substances are involved and a Hot Zone is established
More than 2 Entry Control Points have been set up
Live fire training is being undertaken.
Operating in unusual or unfamiliar circumstances.
Whenever FENZ is not the lead agency and a Safety Officer is required for FENZ operations.
For incidents involving Aerial appliances
correctAnswer: Hazardous substances are involved and a Hot Zone is established
Live fire training is being undertaken.
Operating in unusual or unfamiliar circumstances.
Whenever FENZ is not the lead agency and a Safety Officer is required for FENZ operations.

options: Mayday message
Continuous operation of all vehicle sirens
Operation of the Distress Signal Unit
Whistles
structure.correctAnswer: Continuous operation of all vehicle sirens

structure.description: What must all personnel do on hearing the emergency evacuation signal?
options: Shut down firefighting deliveries at the nozzle.
Carry out a quick search for personnel or patients
Withdraw to a place of safety.
Recover any equipment that might get lost or damaged
Uplift BA tallies from the Entry Control Officer and return to their appliance.
correctAnswer: Shut down firefighting deliveries at the nozzle.
Withdraw to a place of safety.
Uplift BA tallies from the Entry Control Officer and return to their appliance.

structure.description: What must the OIC do on hearing the emergency evacuation signal?
options: Uplift nominal roll tallies and conduct a head count.
Send in relief team to continue operations
Advise the OIC Fire of the result.
correctAnswer: Uplift nominal roll tallies and conduct a head count.
Advise the OIC Fire of the result.

structure.description: At hazardous materials incidents the OIC should consider appointing a Hazard Control Officer to assist with the management of the incident.
At the end of the incident the person responsible for the building should be briefed on any remaining hazards before FENZ relinquishes responsibility of the site.
Significant Hazard Exposure Protocols must be followed if a significant health hazard or potentially significant health hazard is identified.
